cheatsheet.title: Create a new UML Papyrus Project

intro.description: In this cheat sheet you will learn how to create a new UML Papyrus Project

item.title: Open Papyrus Perspective
item.description: First step is to enable the Papyrus Perspective. Click on the menu "Window->Perspective->Open Perspective->Other" and select Papyrus from the list

item.title: Create a new project
item.description: To create a new Project, simply click on the menu "File->New->Papyrus Project". The wizard to create the new project will be opened

item.title: Configure the project properties
item.description: In the first step, you need to specify the Language of the contained diagrams. Select UML as value and click on Next

item.title: Set the project and default model name
item.description: Set the project name in the field. Also you can set the name of the default model. Click on Next

item.title: Select the kind of diagrams by default
item.description: The default created model, can contain one or more diagrams by default. You can select them in this window. Also you can specify if you want to include the default basic primitives or not. The name of the root element of the model can be specified here too. And finally, you can choose a profile and apply it to the whole model (this step can be performed after creating the model). Click on Finish to complete the process

item.title: Start modeling
item.description: The default model is opened and now you can start modeling!

subitem.label: Add new diagrams if no one exists by clicking "Create View" button in the opened model
